newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: TENNIS-COETZER BLOWS AWAY AMERICAN HOPEFUL.
newsitem.headline: TENNIS-COETZER BLOWS AWAY AMERICAN HOPEFUL.

text.p: Tiny South African Amanda Coetzer produced more big winners on Tuesday to beat American hopeful Kimberly Po and earn a place in the semifinals of the Australian Open.

The number 12 seed, who on Sunday toppled top seed Steffi Graf on a baking centre court, had the luxury of playing under a roof and air conditioning after tournament organisers decided that the heat was too much for players and public to bear.
She beat Po 6-4 6-1 in a match lasting 67 minutes.
Coetzer is seen as the player with the best chance of beating Swiss starlet Martina Hingis if the two make it through to the final and Tuesday's performance would have reinforced that opinion.
Although Po managed to break Coetzer's serve once in each set, the South African converted six of six break points. She wrapped up the match by breaking Po to love at 5-1.
Coetzer's semifinal opponent will be either Belgium's 16th seed Sabine Appelmans or 1995 champion Mary Pierce of France.
